secret_rule: Only items that are associated with a famous event in history can be brought to the picnic.

conversation.content: To start, here are some examples of items you can bring: "moon rock" and "Declaration of Independence".
Can I bring a "beach ball"?
No, you cannot bring a beach ball.
Can I bring "Eiffel Tower"?
Yes, you can bring the Eiffel Tower.
Can I bring "Mount Everest"?
No, you cannot bring Mount Everest.
Can I bring the "Mona Lisa"?
Yes, you can bring the Mona Lisa.
Can I bring a "diamond ring"?
No, you cannot bring a diamond ring.
Can I bring the "Statue of Liberty"?
Yes, you can bring the Statue of Liberty.
Can I bring the "Sphinx of Giza"?
Yes, you can bring the Sphinx of Giza.
Can I bring the "Great Wall of China"?
Yes, you can bring the Great Wall of China.
Can I bring the "Leaning Tower of Pisa"?
Yes, you can bring the Leaning Tower of Pisa.
The rule seems to be that you can only bring items that are man-made and of significant historic or cultural value.
Correct! The rule is Only items that are associated with a famous event in history can be brought to the picnic.
